result.markdown: --- engine: knitr knitr: opts_chunk: collapse: true editor: markdown: wrap: 72 --- :::: {.callout-important collapse='false' appearance='default' icon=false} ## [Caution]{style='font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.25em;'} ::: {style='font-size: 1.00em; color: #282b2d;'} This book is under development. Thank you for your patience. ::: :::: # Welcome! {.unnumbered} Welcome to my Unix/Linux Field Manual! This book aims to provide a quick reference for basic concepts and common tasks when using Unix/Linux operating systems.[^zsh-bash] :::: {.callout-tip collapse='true' appearance='simple' icon=false} ## [What is a 'Field Manual'?]{style='font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.15em;'} ::: {style='font-size: 1.00em; color: #282b2d;'} A field manual (FM) is an educational tool, providing standardized information, instructions, and techniques for operational concepts and procedures. ![Example improvised litter made using tent poles and field jackets.](img/jacket-pole-litter.png) FMs function as both reference material and living documentation, encouraging updates and adaptation based on the given situation, changes in technology, or the environment.[^field-manuals] [^field-manuals]: Based on the [U.S. Army Field Manuals (FMs).](http://www.lexpev.nl/downloads/fm531boobytraps1965.pdf) ::: :::: [^zsh-bash]: Most of these commands will work on any Shell (Zsh, Bash, etc.) program. :::: {.callout-note collapse='false' appearance='simple' icon=false} ## [See a typo, error, or something missing?]{style='font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.15em;'} ::: {style='font-size: 1.00em; color: #282b2d;'} Please open an issue on [GitHub.](https://github.com/mjfrigaard/fm-unix/issues/new) ::: ::::
